children.name: stuff
children.definition: nounQUALITY
examples: [ U ]USIn baseball, apitcher's stuff is the quality andvarietyof theirpitches(= throws to the player hitting the ball)
_Avery hadgreatstuff, total command of all three of his pitches.

children.name: home run
children.definition: noun (informalhomer)USbànthắnglớn
examples: a point scored in baseball by hitting the ball so far that you have time to run all the way round the four corners of the playing field before it is returned
homernoun[ C ]USinformal bànthắnglớn
a home run

children.name: strike out
children.definition: strike(sb)outphrasal verb 3 lần đánh hỏng/ làm ai đánh hỏng 3 lần
examples: to fail three times to hit the ball successfully in baseball and therefore to lose one of your team'schances to score, or to cause someone to do this
_The pitcher struck out both batters in the ninth inning and saved the game.
strikeoutnoun[ C ] ba lần đánh bóng hỏng
(in baseball) the act of failing three times to hit the ball, or of making abatter(= persontrying to hit the ball) do this
_He averaged 14 strikeouts per game last season.

children.name: infielder
children.definition: (in baseball) a defensive player who is positioned in the infield, playing first base, second base, third base, or shortstop : người đứng chặn bóng trong sân
examples: the infielder made a sliding catch near the foul line

children.name: batter
children.definition: the person in baseball or rounders whose turn it is to hit the ball, or a person who is good at this activity : cầu thủ đánh bóng

children.name: catcher
children.definition: in baseball, the player who catches the ball if the batter fails to hit it : người bắt bóng

children.name: outfielder
children.definition: a player positioned on the grassy area beyond the infield : cầu thủ ở khu vực ngoài
examples: He was a star outfielder for the Brooklyn Dodgers.

children.name: pitcher
children.definition: a player who pitches the ball in a baseball game : cầu thủ ném bóng

children.name: double play
children.definition: the action of making two runners in a game of baseball have to leave the field by throwing the ball quickly from one base to another before the runners reach either one : hai cầu thủ bị rút ra khỏi sân

children.name: double
children.definition: a hit in baseball which allows the batter to reach second base :
examples: Walker led the inning with a double.

children.name: single
children.definition: in baseball, a hit which allows the player to reach first base : cú đánh ăn điểm 1 góc
examples: single[ I ] a baseball player singles by hitting a ball that allows him to reach first base.

children.name: strike
children.definition: (in baseball) a ball that has been thrown by the pitcher and not been hit successfully when it should have been : cú đánh hỏng
examples: A batter is out after three strikes.

children.name: grand slam
children.definition: a hit in baseball which gets four points because it is a home run and there are players on all the bases : cú đánh ăn 4 điểm

children.name: hit
children.definition: in baseball, when the batter safely reaches first base after hitting the ball : cú đánh thành công

children.name: pitch
children.definition: to aim and throw a ball in baseball: ném bóng
examples: Johnny learned to pitch by aiming at a target his Dad had painted on the side of the garage.
Ryan pitched a curve ball which easily beat the batter.
Stoddard pitched for the Chicago White Sox.
pitch to
Stanton pitched to two batters in the ninth inning.
pitch[C]
The pitch went wide.
His first pitch was high and wide.

children.name: foul
children.definition: a hit in baseball which goes outside the limits of the playing area : đánh bóng ngoài sân
examples: foul[I or T] to hit a ball outside the limit of the playing area in baseball

children.name: foul ball
children.definition: in baseball, a ball hit outside the playing field on either side : quả bóng hỏng

children.name: groundout
children.definition: a play in which a batter is put out by hitting a ground ball to a fielder who throws it to first base before the batter touches that base.
examples: he proceeded to second base on a groundout

children.name: pop fly
children.definition: in baseball, a ball which is hit very high in the air but not very far : cú đánh bổng lên

children.name: slice
children.definition: in the sports of golf and baseball, when you hit a ball so that it goes to one side rather than straight in front : cú đánh xoáy
examples: slice[ T ] in the sports of golf and baseball, to hit a ball so that it goes to one side rather than straight in front : đánh xoáy ( qua bong )
Sara sliced the ball, sending it a hundred metres or so to the left.

children.name: grounder
children.definition: / ground ballUS  a ball that is hit along the ground in a game of baseball: bón lập bập

children.name: fastball
children.definition: a ball that is thrown very hard and quickly towards the batter in a game of baseball : cú ném cực nhanh
examples: The pitcher wound up and let loose a fastball.

children.name: peg
children.definition: US informal a low fast throw in baseball cú ném sệt
examples: peg[ T ] US informal to throw a ball in baseball low and fast : ném sệt
Mattingly pegged the ball to Stanley.

children.name: curve ball
children.definition: in baseball, a ball that spins and moves in a curve when it is thrown, so that it is difficult to hit : cú ném bóng cong

children.name: screwball
children.definition: US a ball which is thrown during a baseball game so that it curves to one side : cú ném bóng xoáy

children.name: inning
children.definition: one of the nine playing periods in a game of baseball or softball, during which both sides have a turn at batting.: lượt chơi
examples: Then in the seventh inning, the center fielder singled home the go-ahead run.

children.name: the World Series
children.definition: a series of baseball games played each year in North America to decide which is the region's best team : giải vô địch bóng chày Hoa Kỳ

children.name: baseball
children.definition: the ball used in baseball : quả bóng chày
examples: He had a baseball and a couple of bats in his sports bag.

children.name: backstop
children.definition: (in baseball) a high fence or similar structure behind the home plate area: rào chắn banh
examples: We'd stand at home plate facing the backstop, and he'd give us five pitches per turn.

children.name: left field
children.definition: a position in baseball in the left side of the outfield: sân ngoài bên trái

children.name: base
children.definition: one of the four positions on a square that a player must reach to score a point in the game of baseball.
examples: first base[C usually S] in baseball, the first of four places you must run to after hitting the ball and before scoring a point, or the position of a player defending this place
Mattingleyplayedfirst base for the Yankees.
second basethe second of the four places you have to run to in games such as baseball in order to get a point

children.name: home plate
children.definition: / home base the place where you stand to hit the ball in baseball, and the last place the player who is running must touch in order to get a point

children.name: batter's box
children.definition: in baseball, the place where the batter stands when he or she is trying to hit the ball

children.name: bullpen
children.definition: US in baseball, a place near the playing area where pitchers (= people throwing the ball) can throw the ball to get ready to play in the game : khu vực dành riêng cho cầu thủ ném bóng khởi động

children.name: mound
children.definition: /pitcher’s mound the small hill that the pitcher stands on in the game of baseball : mô đất cầu thủ ném đứng
